text: Draft at the ferm. Pours clear yellow with a medium sized white head. The aroma has a lot of pine, a very fruit forward blend of citrus, a touch of grass. The taste is all mosaic hops with only a touch of a cracker malt balance. Well done.

Growler from Fermentaria location. Pours a murky yellow pear color with a medium sized white head. Aroma of mango, melon, Mosaic hops and hints of apple juice. Taste of mango, melon, Mosaic hops and fruity hard candies.

[ Keg ][ 2oz ][ Festival of Dankness ][ ~$2 ][ Plastic Taster ][ 8.22.15 ]
>> Mosaic version pouring at the festival. Poured cloudy yellow with small foam. Childrens apple juice box aroma. Taste is sweet, dead carbonation. Flabby. Harsh finish with tannic mango skin.
Hazy pale yellow color. Aroma of earthy summer fruit. Taste has earthy lemonlime and subtle melon. Tasty.

Growler shared by Michael T. Thanks man!

Mildly hazy yellow body with a quarter inch of soapy, bone white head. Nice mosaic presence. Fruity, mild sweetness. Mango character is there. Light bodied and elegant palate. Tasty!

Yeah yeah yeah, the vaunted Tired Hands. 32oz growler from the brewery, 4 days old. No pop when the swing top opens. Hazy, neon yellow body with a ring of white head. Hardly carbonated. Mosaic beers hit odd nerve endings for me, I always smell sour cream in addition to chive. Its not unappealing, its just funny. Plenty of grass on the nose too, mango, guava, light soap, a little candy. Flavor is good, very fruity, mango, guava, starfuit, tangerine, light hand soap, perfume, grass, chive. Finishes oily and without much pop, thanks to the non-existent carb. A lot like many of their other beers.

Pours a hazy golden color with a medium white head...nice lacing...bright. Aroma has bright mango, hints of peach and pine. Flavor follows suit...bright mango buy no sweetness to it. Mouthfeel is light / medium and silky with a dry rindy finish. Awesome!
pours a hazy golden orange with a thick white head. Aroma of orange, grapefruit and mango. Taste follows, so juicy and bitter. great Ripa

Growler with thanks to Petrinoda! Pours cloudy apricot, full of mango chunks large and small. Wow. Small white head that dissipates slowly leaving solid lacing. Aroma is powerful dank mosaic goodness, passionfruit, pot, really amazing. Flavor is a wonderful mix of dank dank mosaic hops and mango, hugely tropical. Light sweet, and light plus bitter. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. This beer is truly an experience...
Growler. Pours hazed gold with a white head. Dank ass fruity hops, melon, pine, and fruit salad thats been sitting in the sun for a few hours. Moderate bitterness and fresh dank hoppy goodness.

On tap at the anniversary. Could smell this from a few feet away. Hazy golden-orange body, medium sized off-white head, soapy lacing. Dank mango, pine, tropical juice, resin, and pineapple. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation, dry throughout, assertive bitterness, bangin.

Growler. Didnt take live notes, as I didnt think this counted. Golden pour with white head. Mango, floral, citrus hop aromas. I feel like the hop change isnt that significant, flavors are still hop and mango forward.

Had a few pints of this during the Anniversary party. Pours turbid orange with medium white head. Aroma and flavor are dank mango, pine, tangy grass, mineral water, and other tropical citrus forward notes. Body is medium to full with perfect amount of bitterness. Might be my favorite batch theyve done. Prime hop juice right here.
UPDATED: JUN 3, 2015 Growler. Pours gold white head. Nose/taste of green onion, citrus, mango, pineapple, funk and salted citrus - medium body.

Swing-top from the source, a few days old. My rating #3500! enjoyed while watching the last episode of SOA. Typical cloudy orange with webby lacing around the edge. Nose is cat, fresh cut grass, mango and pine. So dank, so fruity. Crisp and juicy with tiny carb prickles. Taste is mango, pine, orange peel and quinine. A delightful transition from sweet to bitter that calls you back for another sip.
